thread.title: Trump issues construction permit for Keystone XL pipeline | New York Post
thread.title_full: Trump issues construction permit for Keystone XL pipeline | New York Post

author: Marisa Schultz
title: Trump issues construction permit for Keystone XL pipeline | New York Post
text:
WASHINGTON – The Trump administration issued a permit Friday to build the Keystone XL crude oil pipeline, allowing for the controversial and long-stalled $8 billion project to be completed.
The State Department’s decision ends a several years long battle between boosters of the energy industry and environmental advocates.
The project had been blocked during the Obama Administration over environmental concerns and political pressure. But in the first week in office, President Trump issued an executive order to revive the project .
Two days later, TransCanada submitted its new application for approval Jan. 26.
Trump’s State Department concluded the crude oil pipeline would “serve the national interest” and would benefit “foreign policy; energy security; environmental, cultural, and economic impact,” according to the department.
The 1,700-mile pipeline would carry 800,000 barrels of oil per day from Alberta, Canada, to refineries along the Texas Gulf Coast.
Even with a presidential permit, the pipeline’s exact route is uncertain, as Native American tribes and landowners continue to oppose it in the courts.
